title: GitHub Pages
description:
A Lightweight framework to get you started.
Build a digital collection totally online using GitHub and GitHub Pages for all configurations and object storage.
points: Classroom Projects;Serverless Omeka;Small Collections;Learning about Git, Static Web Technologies, web development and design

title: Stand Alone
description: Build a Stand Alone, totally self-contained digital collection with search, vizualization and browsing features enabled. This framework preceded CSV.
points: Self-contained collections or Small Digital Libraries;Taking Complete Control of Your Metadata, Objects, and Design; Deployed on any web server;Search powered by Lunr.js

title: CSV
description:
A robust, metadata-driven collection.
Build a sustainable Stand Alone project on a highly customizable base using the newest version of CollectionBuilder.
points: Flexible object locations and representations;Designed for easier customization and creating new visualizations;Fully self-contained projects;Focus on metadata and curate items from anywhere

title: Elastic
description: Build a Full Digital Library, connecting all your stand alone Collections with an Elasticsearch and Digital Ocean Spaces enabled digital library.
points: Full Digital Libraries with full-text and cross-collection searching;Jumping Ship from Proprietary Systems and Bloated Contracts;Taking Complete Control of Your Metadata, Objects, and Design

title: CONTENTdm
description: Build a CONTENTdm Skin to put on top of one or more CONTENdm collections, using your systems API to build an engaging exhibit. Can be modified for other systems and APIs.
points: Bringing the Most out of your current Digital Collections;Creating New Thematic Collections and Exhibits;Incorporating Non-Developers into the Building and Design Process

title: Sheets
description: Build a Google Sheets driven version of CollectionBuilder. Publish your Sheet and add the link to the repository to generate a CollectionBuilder site.
points: Great for records-only sites; Focus on the spreadsheet; Minimal repository work; Same great CollectionBuilder framework.
